image.altText: Streaks of light are seen in a black night sky above a highway busy with cars

props.synopsis: Iran has fired several ballistic missiles at US military bases in Qatar, as the war in the region continues to expand. Follow live.

title.children: Iran says no 'agreement' yet on Trump ceasefire

image.altText: Albanese

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has welcomed news of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, after US President Donald Trump made the announcement on social media this morning. Follow live. Â Â

title.children: Albanese welcomes ceasefire news in Israel-Iran war

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Democratic and Republican politicians urge Hegseth to back AUKUS

Wells 'considering' advice on YouTube carve out

image.altText: A model of 3D printed oil barrels is seen in front of displayed stock graph going down in this illustration taken.

props.synopsis: Stocks and the Australian dollar rise as Donald Trump declares a ceasefire deal between Israel and Iran. Iranian officials say there is currently no "agreement", but that has yet to trouble markets. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Oil price plunges while Aussie dollar and ASX climb on ceasefire

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Virgin shares rallying on return to ASX
Virgin Australia to relist on ASX at midday
Iran says there's currently no agreement on a ceasefire

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures with his fists standing on a stage in front of US troops with Qatar flag behind.

props.synopsis: With a substantial military footprint in the Middle East, thousands of American troops are within Iran's striking distance if Tehran retaliates against US strikes on its nuclear facilities.Â

title.children: Warships, troops, bases: A look at US military assets in the Middle East

image.altText: Andrew Hastie sits for an interview in a room. He has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The Coalition frontbencher is also urging the Labor government explain what role Australia might play backing US combat operations launched from this country.Â

title.children: Hastie demands answer about US military's growing presence in Australia

image.altText: An older man sitting on the steps of an old house, his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: The Uniting Church wanted a tribunal to sign off on its bid to evict the couple to make way for a big housing estate â€” and to keep details secret from the media and the public.Â

title.children: Uniting Church wanted to limit media coverage of move to evict ex-homeless couple

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Justice Christopher Beale begins his final instructions to the jury before they start their deliberations. The instructions are expected to go for at least two days. Follow his address as it happens.

title.children: Judge in Erin Patterson murder trial begins instructions to jury

image.altText: Claire sifting through documents strewn on her living room floor.

props.synopsis: The lives of about 50,000 Australians are under the control of state-appointed guardians and trustees, but some are being used against them under a veil of intense secrecy.

title.children: Kayla's life was taken over by the government. She's gagged from speaking out

image.altText: julie inman grant speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Julie Inman Grant writes to new Communications Minister Anika Wells, advocating for the inclusion of the video-streaming platform.Â

title.children: Online safety authority wants YouTube included in social media ban

image.altText: A brain illustration with network pattern behind it in turquoise.

props.synopsis: AI is starting to take over the jobs of workers. But it's not the workers you might think.Â

title.children: For all the noise around productivity, the solution may be obvious

image.altText: The vascular system of a piece of wood infested by shot hole borer beetles

props.synopsis: There are growing concerns the polyphagous shot-hole borer will devastate Western Australia's native forests if it spreads outside Perth.

title.children: Fears for native species as invasive shot-hole borer's spread 'inevitable'

image.altText: A lightly browned pale slab sitting on a plate.

props.synopsis: Australia is among only a handful of countries around the world to have deemed it safe for sale, while several countries and US states have banned it.

title.children: 'Lab-grown meat' has been approved for sale in Australia. Will people eat it?

image.altText: An anonymous silhouette of a woman with curly hair as she stares out a window.

props.synopsis: The Indigenous woman says trying to get help from government support services for herself and her four young children has been "like talking to a brick wall".

title.children: Sarah was denied emergency housing, despite fleeing a violent ex-partner

image.altText: A crystal blue beach with a boat by the beach.

props.synopsis: Only students, medical patients and people purchasing essential goods will be allowed to enter or leave Thailand under the new rules.

title.children: Tourists blocked from crossing from Thailand to Cambodia

image.altText: a picture of a large broken pipe under water

props.synopsis: A steamship lost to a fierce storm off the New South Wales South Coast has been seen in person for the first time since it sank 120 years ago.

title.children: Divers explore century-old mystery of Nemesis shipwreck for first time

image.altText: Two people in a car.

props.synopsis: Finke Desert Race co-driver Bernie Webb says a safety mechanism kept him and his driver safe after they lost control at 160kph.

title.children: Desert racers release cabin video of high-speed, airborne crash

image.altText: Li Tu with his eye on the tennis ball, preparing to hit a backhand shot

props.synopsis: Australian tennis players Li Tu, Tristan Schoolkate, James McCabe and Alex Bolt win their first matches at Wimbledon qualifying.Â

title.children: Aussies make bright start to Wimbledon qualifying

image.altText: Tara holding her son in the garden

props.synopsis: Tara Sawyer was told the local hospital would not be able to provide her with maternity care due to her high BMI. It ended up a "blessing in disguise", when Tara was connected with a program designed for women like her.

title.children: The maternity care that took Tara's BMI out of the equation

image.altText: Young violinist Chloe Chua in a black and white gown performing in front of the Singapore Symphony Orchestra in Sydney.

props.synopsis: From Geoffrey Tozer to child prodigies today, audiences are fascinated by young performers. We ask how these musicians balance their passion with other interests.

title.children: Child prodigies speak about the importance of just being kids

image.altText: Keir Starmer and Vololdymyr Zelenskyy about to hug on the steps of 10 Downing Street.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president says overnight strikes on Kyiv serve as a warning to other nations bordering Russia, Iran and North Korea, as he meets with King Charles and discusses security with the British prime minister.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls Russia, Iran and North Korea 'coalition of murderers' during UK visit

image.altText: A woman in a red dress and young  adult in a collared shirt standing on a beach

props.synopsis: The success stories of the NDIS "are now at risk", health providers and their regional clients warn, ahead of travel allowance payments being cut in half from next week.

title.children: 'Don't take that away from us': Mother warns of NDIS travel cuts for therapists

image.altText: A smashed ute on a highway near a large livestock truck that is also damaged.

props.synopsis: A crash on what police say is a "problematic" section of the New England Highway has sparked calls for safety improvements.

title.children: Calls for Back Creek Bridge upgrade after crash leaves man fighting for life

image.altText: Inside the Alexander Library building, which has soaring atriums and lots of windows.

props.synopsis: Perth's Alexander Library was new and exciting when it was built in the '80s. And it still feels that way today.

title.children: Why this 1980s grand design stands the test of time as a Perth icon

image.altText: A small boat heads towards a turbine in the ocean.

props.synopsis: The federal government looks close to approving two major developers to start feasibility studies on building an offshore wind farm off WA's south-west coast.

title.children: European energy giants lead race to build WA's first offshore wind farm

image.altText: gas fitter carries out service on gas water heater in Perth backyard

props.synopsis: From 2027, old gas hot water systems will be replaced with electric ones in homes under new reforms aimed at tackling emissions and gas shortages.

title.children: Gas is on the way out as Victoria continues push for all-electric homes

image.altText: Two orcas photographed from above - orcas pressed together kelp piece just visible between them.

props.synopsis: For the first time, researchers say they have captured footage of killer whales making tools out of seaweed to seemingly groom each other.

title.children: Scientists capture first evidence of orcas using seaweed to make tools

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of an electoral official wearing blue vest.

props.synopsis: After an issue-plagued state election, the WAEC is now down on senior staff members as it prepares for another round of elections.

title.children: Problem-plagued WA Electoral Commission lacking executive staff

image.altText: British and Irish Lions' Sione Tuipulotu running with the rugby ball in two hands during a match

props.synopsis: Born in Victoria and growing up surrounded by Australian Rules, Sione Tuipulotu's rise to the British and Irish Lions follows hard work, perseverance, and the willingness to take a chance.

title.children: From Frankston to Scotland, Sione is plotting the Wallabies' downfall

image.altText: India's Karun Nair walks off the field after losing his wicket as England players converge behind him in celebration

props.synopsis: Another India lower-order collapse gives England a fighting chance of a thrilling victory in the first Test at Headingley, with the hosts 0-21 in their second innings at the close of play on day four, chasing 371 to win.

title.children: India batting collapse gives England hope of dramatic Test win

image.altText: A long table covered with packages leads to a group of people in orange prison uniforms

props.synopsis: Indonesian police have arrested nearly 300 people in recent months for alleged drug offences, but have singled out women in a warning about forming relationships that could see them mixed up in crime.

title.children: Indonesian women urged to be more 'vigilant' after drug crackdown

image.altText: brown cows stand in a pen

props.synopsis: The federal government revises the feedlot industry's contribution to greenhouse gas emissions after adopting a new equation to calculate methane from grain-fed cattle burps.

title.children: Emissions from grain-fed cattle 'burps' revised significantly lower

image.altText: Bull dog Hank sitting on the grass, with green dense bushes behind him and the sun shining in the sky.

props.synopsis: Hank the Tank is believed to have spent 30 days lost in chilly, dense Victorian bushland before making his way back home.

title.children: Bulldog offers owner 'dopiest look' after going missing for a month

image.altText: A basin at a low level of water

props.synopsis: In a bid to conserve water, authorities across the state have been forced to move to very unusual winter restrictions.

title.children: Winter water restrictions turned on for three Victorian regions

image.altText: A woman wearing a raincoat stands in a forested setting.

props.synopsis: Well-versed viewers will find similarities with rom-coms like Bridget Jones and Notting Hill in this sweet yet strange rom-com that keeps you guessing.

title.children: Jane Austen rom-com makes cheeky nods to Bridget Jones, Hugh Grant
